name: rosie
text: I love Philippe, and I like how Zell and Cory help and protect him. Thank heavens for the moonless night to protect his fragile little mind.

name: unsentletter
text: Oh, me too... and by that I mean I feel thankful that they're looking out for him, despite the Circumstances.

name: delzhand
text: This strip is... hard to define.  It's very... stark.

name: patkun
text:
"They fall in among the trash and become it and are gone"
Pure poetry.

name: dzieger
text: I hate "me too" posts, but I gotta say, that was exactly my thought. This is poetry. A lot of achewood is poetry. Hell, someof the characters seem to speak in blank verse as often as not. Genius.

name: hipjiverobot
text: One of the best Achewood comics, and one with no joke.

name: bhlaab
text: A comment left by bhlaab was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ocarinak, riotdejaneiro, Overmedicated, Deusoma, GMM, hikikomori, logic, Doc_Rostov, tragicone)

name: hipjiverobot
text: You're an awful person.

name: atticusonline
text: me too

name: tragicone
text: This is why Onstad writes the best comic in very many years.

name: fourninefoxtrot
text:
"They fall in among the trash and become it and are gone"

This line puts me in mind of this poem:

These, in the day when heaven was falling,
The hour when earth's foundations fled,
Followed their mercenary calling,
And took their wages, and are dead.

Their shoulders held the sky suspended;
They stood, and earth's foundations stay;
What God abandoned, these defended,
And saved the sum of things for pay.

A.E. Housman

name: tombsgrave
text: The scariest Achewood ever.  Zell and Cory are deeply unsettlin', and thus awesome.

name: i_love_kate
text: Oh, sure. They're ugly, so there's something scary about them.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Time has gnawed at them like a coin until there is nothing left of them for themselves.

Jackie Leven

name: cheeks_jd
text: Man, the standing ones face is FUCKED.

name: jesler729
text:
Well I mean

At least he can stand

name: professorhazard
text:
I hope Philippe has a decidedly masculine voice.

Otherwise, I don't want to know why two blind people know he is a "little boy".

name: sje46
text: You can tell a little boy's voice apart from a little girl's.

name: norsef
text:
I'm not sure they're blind. In the previous strip the guy pointed at Phillipe.

Not all blind people are magic.

name: honesttom
text: Zell and Cory... Trouble Man and No-No... Emeril and Spongebath... Are short poetic guy/tall silent guy duos allocated to every part of the Achewood universe?

name: soticoto
text: Onstad been watching too many Kevin Smith films.

name: numberkillinger
text: any amount is too many

name: mustconcentrate
text: I chubbied this so hard I sprained my chubbying finger.

name: tragicone
text: I will have you know that I enjoy Kevin Smith films.

name: woodenteeth
text: I have watched a couple and not been horrified or felt like I have wasted my time.

name: firesign
text:
That is a case of Tall, Extremely Talkative Irritating Asshole Guy/Not Quite As Tall (But Not Really Short) Silent And Poetic Guy.

Very different from Short Poetic Guy/Tall Silent Guy.

name: snoozebar
text:
Nobody else will appreciate this story besides you, Acheworld.

I live several towns over from Chris Onstad. Which is mostly amusing - he often references nearby stores or landmarks and I get that "oh haha that's actually real world place " feeling. Is charming.

We had a grody old couch that needed disposal, so my boyfriend rented a truck, we tossed it in, and halfway there I realized we were taking a couch to the transfer station . I remember this strip, and am mildly creeped out/pleased. Then we arrive.

The transfer station is a giant warehouse, dim, with pinpoint lights casting a horrible, washed-out light. You make out twenty foot mounds of mangled things. Next to you, a dead-eyed Mexican wearing a mask shovels waste like his family depends on it. Covering the floor is a runny sludge, which looks like if you touched it, they'd be forced to cut bits of you off to save your life.

Even my Achewood-illiterate boyfriend is creeped out. We dump the couch and get the fuck out of there. No one should go to the transfer station at all if they can help it.

name: unsentletter
text: holy crap, snoozebar!  wow.  what town was this particular transfer station in?

name: niggar
text: They collect violets and daffodils.  You wouldn't want to put them in your mouth.

name: jonmw
text: Most flowers are edible. Try it!

name: woodenteeth
text: My secret shame!

name: shemmjacc
text: Best arc. I love Achewood when it gets... horrifying.

name: o2b
text: What is up with Phillipe's shoes? Is he wearing pilgrim shoes?

name: vymora
text: Those are Phillip's normal shoes.  They are usually obscured by his pants.

name: jonmw
text: His other, non-ridiculous pants.

name: baryonyx
text: I...I can hear Zell's rasping voice when I read this.

name: tragicone
text: I dunno, i somehow give Zell a light and high voice with a deep yet obscured southern accent.

name: jonmw
text: I thought light and high, but also somewhat hoarse/raspy.

name: soticoto
text: Kitten-Huffers?! O_O;

name: tellumo
text:
What I tell you three times is true. . What Onstad tells you thrice three times about Zell and Cory is so true that you should run from the very thought of them.

And never, never put it in your mouth.

name: jonmw
text:
Which one is Zell, and which one is Cory?
Will we EVER know?

name: i_love_kate
text: Actually, they collect truffles.

name: snowman
text: I'm on my second trawl through the archive, rating everything this time, and it just occurred to me -- I can't remember the last time I gave a strip anything less than a 5.  Incredible.

name: madisonsquare
text: I can say it! I will say it nine times!
